item.title: Battlefield 6 Campaign Has BF3 Connection You Might Have Missed
item.description:
This article contains spoilers related to the plot and missions of Battlefield 6's single-player campaign.

Battlefield 6 's campaign incorporates some pretty significant callbacks to the events of past games, and in particular, Battlefield 3 , with one of its missions planting the seeds of villainous organization Pax Armata. While having played past games in the series certainly isn't a prerequisite to enjoying Battlefield 6 , longtime fans may notice how the events of Battlefield 3 have carried over into the newest game's campaign.

Launched on October 10, Battlefield 6 has seen huge player numbers on Steam that put it at or near the top of the list for the biggest games of 2025. On its launch date, more than 747,000 concurrent players were recorded on Steam, and though the game has been out for less than a week, its daily peaks have not dipped below 474,000.

Battlefield 3's Story Heavily Influences the Battlefield 6 Experience

While the bulk of the fan base's attention has been directed at the game's various competitive team-based multiplayer modes, Battlefield 6 also features a nine-mission campaign that pits players against Pax Armata, a technologically superior private military force that plays outside the rules of warfare. This new threat provides the campaign with a convenient villain in the wake of NATO's collapse. But, as pointed out by ComicBook, one thing players may not know is that Henry Blackburn, the protagonist and playable character for the majority of Battlefield 3 's campaign, was tied up in a mission that led to Pax Armata's rise through its leader, Alexander Kincaid.

During Battlefield 6 's Night Raid mission, Dagger 13 Master Sgt. Haz Carter recounts, from his own perspective, the tale originally told in the similarly titled Night Shift, a stealth mission near the end of Battlefield 3. In that mission, Blackburn attempts to capture the antagonistic Faruk Al-Bashir, leader of the People's Liberation and Resistance. But while Blackburn was pulling off heroic feats, Carter was faring more poorly, with his unit cornered by an enemy battalion. Kincaid, the leader of an SAS unit that was with Carter, went back to help his men, but Carter pulled his forces out of the battlefield without him, presumably leaving Kincaid and his unit to die and lighting the spark that led him to his leadership role in Pax Armata.

While Blackburn has never made a prominent appearance in a game since Battlefield 3 , the lore surrounding him is growing. After his dishonorable discharge following the events of Battlefield 3 , it's learned in the campaign of Battlefield 4 that he has come to lead his own private military organization, offering security services in Europe and possibly developing new weapons for the Russian military. Considering that he's still around for the events of Battlefield 2042 as founder of the Arkangel Corporation, it's likely that Battlefield 6 won't be the last game in which players hear mention of his name.

item.title: Reasons Why Stardew Valley Is The Most Important Indie Game Ever
item.description:
With its first version releasing way back in 2016, Stardew Valley has since grown into something beyond almost any other indie game out there. Following the announcement of a 1.7 update coming sometime in the future, Stardew Valley fans are more excited than ever about this now-beloved farming sim. Though developer ConcernedApe has warned that it will be awhile before the update releases, players are still eager to see what it will encompass.

In the past nine years, this humble little game has amassed a thriving fanbase and a vibrant modding community, and its popularity shows no signs of flagging. In that time, the indie gaming scene itself has grown exponentially as well. Dozens of games have taken inspiration from Stardew Valley , yet it remains the gold standard of indie farming sims. Here are a few reasons why this game has had such a massive impact.

One Person Created Something Incredible

A Solo Project Full Of Heart

Eric Barone, also known as ConcernedApe, is hardly the first solo developer to create a beloved title. The idea that one person could create a great game had been proven by Toby Fox with Undertale, not long before Stardew Valley released. Barone's farming sim, though, proved it wasn't a fluke.

More than anything, Stardew Valley feels like a labor of love. There's care, detail, and personality built into every corner of the game. It proves that indie games, even those with simple premises, can still feature fully fleshed-out worlds and three-dimensional characters. And it was all done by a single developer, inspiring other solo devs and small teams to do the same.

Revitalized Interest In Farming Sims

The Genre Has Been Booming

Stardew Valley is far from the first game to tackle the concept of creating a thriving farm and building one's place in a community. Eric Barone himself has gone on record saying that the game was inspired by titles like Harvest Moon . But since the game debuted and has increased in popularity, the farming sim genre has seen something of a renaissance, especially in the indie space.

Over the past few years, there's been a boom of cozy life sim games that involve living in harmony with nature. Some stick to the formula, like Sunhaven or Little Witch in the Woods . Others lean into RPG mechanics, like Kynseed . Thousands of players have found a peaceful kind of escapism with Stardew Valley , and that has given rise to a whole new niche of games.

A Huge Variety Of Things To Do

From Farming to Mining to Friendships & More

Despite seeming simple on the surface, Stardew Valley has quite a lot of variety in its gameplay loop. If tending the farm gets tiresome, players can spend a few in-game days delving into the mines, digging up treasure and slaying monsters. If that gets dull, they can spend some time exploring the game's social mechanics, making friends and getting to know the characters better.

This variety is a huge contributor to the game's staying power. It never gets boring. Yet, it never gets overly complicated either, as every activity leads back to the gameplay loop of improving the farm and building new upgrades. Stardew Valley chooses a few things and executes them near-perfectly, giving it an endlessly satisfying replayability that few other indie games have managed to achieve.

It's Still Growing & Evolving

Adding New Content For Almost A Decade

Longtime players have gotten to watch the game grow in real time. Since its first version, updates to Stardew Valley have added new crops, characters, festivals, items, quests, and more. Even for players who feel they've seen everything the game has to offer, the larger updates offer tons of new content, bringing fans back in over and over again. What's more, all of its additions have been free updates rather than paid DLC, making new content easily accessible.

Few other indie games, aside from those in early access, have offered regular free updates like Stardew Valley . It's proven that games always have room to grow, and that there's nothing to stop a developer from continuing to flesh out their ideas in whatever way they want. It encourages creativity and ongoing growth and speaking of which...

The Modding Scene

Players Add Their Own Spin

On the subject of Stardew Valley 's endless potential, it would be remiss not to mention the game's modding scene. It has one of the biggest, most creative modding communities among indie games, with players adding everything from new crops to new storylines. One of the best-known mods is Stardew Valley Expanded, which even adds new marriage candidates to the game.

Stardew Valley and its creator not only support mods for the game, but actively encourage them. The official wiki for the game features its own page with everything that prospective modders need to know to get started. It's relatively easy for even beginners to flex their creativity making mods for Stardew Valley , and it's that innovation that helps keep the game alive.

A Vibrant, Positive Fan Community

Good Vibes Only

It's no secret that gaming communities can be home to a fair amount of negativity and toxicity. However, that's very rarely the case when it comes to Stardew Valley . Perhaps that's partly due to its nature as a cozy, comforting game. Some fans might debate the best marriage candidates or Joja-vs-Community Center routes, but generally, it's all in good fun. Most of the time, when Stardew Valley fans come together to share fan art, show off their in-game farms, or discuss tips and tricks, the overall vibe remains a positive one.

Stardew Valley 's now-popular co-op mode wasn't part of the original game. It was introduced in version 1.3, partially due to how much the fanbase wanted it. Players love building their farms together and inviting friends to share in the game's cozy, comforting world. The welcoming fan community is a draw for new fans and keeps veteran players sticking around, making it a big contributor to the game's longevity. This one-man project has brought people together in a way that few other indie games can claim to have done.

item.title: Battlefield 6: Should You Play With a Controller or Keyboard & Mouse?
item.description:
Battlefield 6 features a wide range of multiplayer modes that will take players from close-quarter battles to large-scale maps that encourage long-range engagements. Regardless of which multiplayer playlist you're matchmaking for, aiming and movement remain one of the most vital aspects you need to master to rack up kills. Players on both PCs and consoles have a choice to either play with a mouse or keyboard. But you might be wondering which input method works best for BF6. Let's analyze both.

Should You Play Battlefield 6 With a Controller or a Keyboard & Mouse?

Battlefield 6 can be played with both keyboard and mouse, as well as controllers, on PC, Xbox, and PlayStation. However, each input method has its own advantages and disadvantages. Since BF6 features Crossplay functionality, PC and console players will eventually be grouped together. So, it's a fair question to ask whether they should play with a controller or a mouse and keyboard to get the upper hand.

Difference Between Playing With a Controller and Keyboard & Mouse

For starters, a mouse is a superior device when it comes to accuracy , which gives players, especially on PC, an edge in aiming (since it's their primary input device). On the other hand, the controller is far more comfortable to play on , allowing you to play BF6 while resting or even lying back on a couch. The aim assist for controllers also helps significantly close the gap in the aiming accuracy between PC and console players.

With that in consideration, both input methods have their pros and cons, and it's solely up to what the players prefer. If you're more comfortable gaming on a keyboard and mouse, go for it. However, if you're more comfortable gaming with a controller and don't care about a drop in aiming accuracy, go for it.

Best Modes for Keyboard and Mouse & Controllers

Instead of helping players pick one or the other, why not go for both? I've garnered a list of all game modes in Battlefield 6 and will recommend the best input device for each one. This way, you'll be able to better identify the modes that can be dominated by a controller, and others that require a bit of precision that a mouse and keyboard have to offer.

Input Device

Best Battlefield 6 Modes

Recommendation Reason

Single-Player Campaign

Single-Player Campaign is best enjoyed with a controller due to its cinematic nature and scripted moments. The multiplayer modes mentioned for controllers are small-scale, as players will be fighting their opponents at close quarters. Gunfights in close proximity will increase the chances of aim-assist kicking in and aiding in aiming, even against players on PC.

Domination

All these modes are recommended for the keyboard and mouse, and are all-out warfare modes, with large-scale maps. You'll be mainly encountering enemies in the open, often at greater distances. Hence, it'll be difficult for the controller's aim assist to kick in that often, and players on keyboard and mouse will have the upper hand.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Cronus Zen Controversy Explained
item.description:
Battlefield 6 is reportedly banning players detected using Cronus Zen devices across both PC and consoles. The purported move sparked some controversy on social media, positioning Battlefield 6 as one of the first titles in recent years to actively counter the perception of Cronus Zen as an undetectable cheating method.

The Cronus Zen is a plug-in input adapter commonly used to extend controllers with scripts and macros (recorded series of inputs). By spoofing gamepad signals, it can provide advantages such as rapid fire and recoil nullification. Because its design circumvents common detection mechanisms, the Cronus Zen has become one of the most widely used cheating tools in first-person shooters since its May 2020 release.

Battlefield 6 Reportedly Cracking Down on Cronus Zen Users

Within days of Battlefield 6 's critically acclaimed October 10 launch, reports have emerged that EA's latest FPS is banning Cronus Zen users. Although one of the widely circulated screenshots supposedly attesting to this development has been accused of being AI-generated, dozens of online testimonies claim the Cronus Zen developers have issued a notice to their customers, warning them not to use the device in Battlefield 6 while they conduct further testing. Game Rant was unable to verify this claim.

Looking at the official Cronus Zen Support Discord server, the only mention of Battlefield 6 that came from the Cronus Zen team suggests the opposite to be the case. "No bans reported when using our BF6 BETA Pack," one of the developers wrote on October 14.

The screengrabbed warning currently making the rounds on social media may have originated from a different Discord server or a private channel reserved for Cronus Zen owners. While the jury is still out on its veracity, Game Rant can confirm that multiple users complained about being banned in Battlefield 6 via the official Cronus Zen Support Discord server. None of them clarified on the circumstances of their suspensions, making it unclear if they were possibly sanctioned for a different reason. One of the Cronus Zen developers alleged that to be the case, claiming Battlefield 6 players "are being banned for using unsafe scripts."

Some Gamers Reject the Notion That Cronus Zen Is Cheating

The ban wave has sparked some online controversy. While many fans are celebrating the reported crackdown, some players have turned to social media to revive the longstanding debate over what constitutes cheating, arguing that accessories like the Cronus Zen fall into a gray area. These views, however, appear to represent a minority of the overall response. EA previously confirmed that Battlefield 6 would launch with a proprietary anti-cheat system, but without elaborating on its specifics. The publisher has also yet to confirm that it is indeed cracking down on Cronus Zen users.

item.title: Best WoW Legion Remix Infinite Power Farms
item.description:
The Artifact Weapon system in WoW Legion Remix is fueled by Infinite Power, an event-exclusive currency that can be spent to progress through the unique Remix Artifact Weapon skill tree. The more Infinite Power you have, the more abilities you will be able to unlock as you level your Legion Remix character.

Even after completing the Legion Remix Artifact Weapon tree, you'll be able to spend Infinite Power on a repeating skill that boosts your Versatility, Stamina, and primary stat. Suffice to say, it's important to get as much Infinite Power as you can to push your character's limits in Legion Remix .

Though some methods to farm Infinite Power were removed from the game, there are still plenty of ways to get Infinite Power in Legion Remix .

Complete Quests & Group Finder Dailies For Caches

Caches of Infinite Treasure Can Reward Infinite Power

The main way to get Infinite Power in WoW Legion Remix is to complete content that rewards Caches of Infinite Treasure. These consumable containers will yield Bronze, Mementos, and Infinite Power when opened. When you complete any quest in Legion Remix , you will earn an uncommon Cache. Completing World Quests rewards Heroic Caches, and daily Infinite Research and Dungeon LFG quests (for both Normal and Heroic) reward epic rarity Caches of Infinite Power.

The amount of Infinite Power you get as a reward from these Caches increases with rarity uncommon Caches will yield a few dozen Infinite Power, while epic Caches can yield hundreds.

Complete Dungeons and Raids On All Difficulties

Dungeon and Raid Bosses Reward Infinite Power, Scaling With Difficulty

In addition to daily Infinite Research quests, players who want to farm Infinite Power should aim to complete as many Dungeons and Raids on Heroic and Mythic different difficulties as possible each day. Though you can still get lots of Infinite Power from the lower difficulty versions, Heroic and Mythic Raids and Dungeons reward significantly more.

In both forms of group content available in Legion Remix , when you beat a boss, you will get some Infinite Power as part of the boss drop rewards. The Heroic and Mythic tiers for Raids are especially good for farming Infinite Power, even more so if you have a lot of Infinite Knowledge, which scales your Infinite Power gain.

Complete Achievements to Increase Infinite Knowledge

Get More Infinite Knowledge To Earn More Infinite Power

If you want to farm as much Infinite Power as possible, as fast as possible, your top priority should be to increase your Infinite Knowledge. The more Infinite Knowledge you have, the more Infinite Power you will earn from all sources.

The only way to get Infinite Knowledge is to complete certain Achievements in WoW Legion Remix . There are more than 25 Achievements that will increase your Infinite Knowledge upon completion, including:

  • The twelve Unlimited Power achievements , which require you to acquire increasing amounts of Infinite Power
  • The five zone loremaster achievements (Lorerunner of Val'Sharah, Azsuna, Stormheim, Highmountain, and Suramar)
  • The three meta Dungeon achievements , labeled as " Legion Dungeons: (group) " in the Remix achievements list
  • Broken Isles World Quests IV & Broken Isles World Bosses , which require you to complete 100 World Quests and beat every World Boss in the Broken Isles, respectively
  • Timeworn Keystone Adept (which requires you to beat a level 7 Mythic Keystone), and both the Emerald Nightmare and Trial of Valor Raid achievements
  • Legionslayer III , which requires you to kill 50 Empowered Enemies in Heroic World Tier

Completing any of these Achievements will reward you with 1x Infinite Knowledge. As you work towards each Achievement, you will earn a lot of Infinite Power via caches and other sources along the way. For example, by completing a zone story, you'll get dozens of Caches of Infinite Wisdom along the way.

If you don't need to upgrade your gear, wait to open your Caches of Infinite Wisdom until you get more Infinite Knowledge to maximize your Infinite Power gain in Legion Remix . Though the gear inside does not scale upon being opened, the Infinite Power gained will scale based on your current Infinite Knowledge.

Scrap All Unused Gear to Get More Infinite Power

Scrapping Equipment Rewards Bronze, Mementos, & Infinite Power

At the very start of the Legion Remix introductory sequence, players are given the Unraveling Sands ability. This ability summons a portal that you can place unwanted equipment into and scrap it for Bronze, Mementos, and Infinite Power. You don't get a lot of Infinite Power from scrapping old gear, and you can only scrap up to nine items at once.

Like other Infinite Power sources, though, the amount of IP you get from scrapping unwanted equipment scales with your Infinite Knowledge and with the rarity of the item being scrapped. If you have the inventory space to spare (which you should, with a Remix Character), wait to scrap your equipment until you've gained a couple of Infinite Knowledge points to get as much out of it as possible.
